External id.long_desc: Unique identifier of image as provided by image capture platform

File path.long_desc: The relevant path (directory) of the image file, including its filename

Donor info - UNOS ID.long_desc: Unique donor identifier provided by donor agency.

Donor info - LIMS ID.long_desc: Unique donor identifier provided via Powers Laboratory LIMS

Donor info - Disease Status.long_desc: One of several diseases associated with donor - ND (No Disease), T1D (Type 1 Diabetes), T2D (Type 2 Diabetes)

Donor info - Disease Duration.long_desc: Time that disease was known/diagnosed in donor

Donor info - Age.long_desc: Age of donor at the time sample was collected

Image info - Section Plane.long_desc: Section plane collected of sample - saggital, coronal, transverse

Image info - Pancreas Region.long_desc: General region the sample was collected from - head, body, tail

Image info - File Type.long_desc: Imaging platform used to collect data

Image info - Analysis.long_desc: Whether or not associated/downstream analysis has been performed

(DS notes).long_desc: Notes left by annotator / safe to ignore

Warning.long_desc: Ideally you should not see this

AMY1A.Antigen description: Amylase alpha 1a; secreted protein helping to catalyze digestion of dietary starch and glycogen

CD31 (PECAM1).Antigen description: Platelet and endothelial cell adhesion molecule 1

CD45 (PTPRC).Antigen description: Protein tyrosine phosphatase, receptor type C

COL4A1.Antigen description: Collagen type IV, alpha 1 chain; integral component of basement membranes

CPA1.Antigen description: Carboxypeptidase A1; enzyme that cleaves branched-chain and aromatic amino acids from dietary proteins

FOXA2.Antigen description: Forkhead box A2; transcription factor that influences α cell development, maturation

GFAP.Antigen description: Glial fibrillary acidic protein; intermediate filament in mature astrocytes

HNF1B*.Antigen description: Hepatocyte nuclear factor 1-beta; transcription factor critical for pancreatic development
HNF1B*.Pancreas cell/region specificity: Pancreatic progenitor cells (De Vas et al. 2002; adult ductal cells (Nammo et al.)

MK167.Antigen description: Nuclear protein associated with cellular proliferation

NEUROG3 (NGN3).Antigen description: Neurogenin 3; transcription factor critical for pancreatic development

NKX6-1*.Antigen description: NK6 homeobox; transcription factor required for β cell development

ONECUT1 (HNF6).Pancreas cell/region specificity: Acinar, ductal cells (Jiang et al. 2008, Pekala et al. 2014

PAX6.Antigen description: Paired box 6; key transcription factor in endocrine development

PDX1.Antigen description: Pancreatic and duodenal homeobox 1; key transcription factor in pancreatic development

SYN1.Antigen description: Synapsin I, neuronal phosphoprotein associated with synaptic vesicles

SYN2.Antigen description: Synapsin II, neuronal phosphoprotein associated with synaptic vesicles

SYP.Antigen description: Synaptophysin, integral membrane protein of small synaptic vesicles

TUBB3.Antigen description: Neuron-specific class III beta-tubulin; core component of microtubules

DAPI.Description: 4′,6-diamidino-2-phenylindole; binds strongly to adenine–thymine rich regions in DNA

Eosin.Description: Red or pink acidic compound that binds to acidophilic substances, such as positively charged amino-acid side chains

H&E.Description: Hematoxylin & Eosin (standard pathology stain to visualize tissue structure)

Hematoxylin.Description: Naturally derived dark blue/violet dye that binds to basophilic substances, such as DNA and RNA

TUNEL.Description: Terminal deoxynucleotidyl transferase dUTP nick end labeling (TUNEL); uses tagged TdT to visualize blunt ends of double-stranded DNA breaks

Sagittal.Description: Plane cutting “cross-sections” or dividing organ into left and right sections

Transverse.Description: Plane dividing into upper and lower segments; also called horizontal or axial

Anatomical Region.Description:
Head: located next to duodenum

Body: located posterior to distal portion of stomach

Tail: located adjacent to the spleen

Tissue Region.Description:
Core: refers to central region of transverse section

Periphery: refers to outer edge of transverse section
